facts.fact: The Los Angeles Dodgers were originally founded in Brooklyn, New York in 1883 as the Brooklyn Atlantics, before moving to LA in 1958.
The LA Galaxy was the first MLS team to win the CONCACAF Champions League in 2000, defeating Olimpia of Honduras.
The Los Angeles Lakers have won 17 NBA championships, tied for the most in NBA history with the Boston Celtics.
The Los Angeles Rams were the first NFL team to have a logo on their helmet, introducing the ram horn design in 1948.
The LA Kings were the first NHL team from California to win the Stanley Cup, doing so in 2012 and 2014.
Dodger Stadium is the third-oldest ballpark in Major League Baseball, opening in 1962.
The Galaxy's home stadium, Dignity Health Sports Park, was the first soccer-specific stadium built in MLS history.
Kobe Bryant scored 81 points in a single game against the Toronto Raptors in 2006, the second-highest single-game total in NBA history.
The Rams' 'Greatest Show on Turf' offense in 1999-2001 was the first team in NFL history to score 500+ points in three consecutive seasons.
The Kings' 'Miracle on Manchester' in 1982 saw them overcome a 5-0 deficit in the third period to beat the Oilers 6-5 in overtime.
Sandy Koufax threw four no-hitters for the Dodgers, including a perfect game in 1965 against the Chicago Cubs.
David Beckham's arrival at the Galaxy in 2007 helped establish MLS as a destination for international stars.
The Lakers' 33-game winning streak in 1971-72 remains the longest in NBA history.
The Rams' move back to Los Angeles in 2016 marked their return after 21 years in St. Louis.
Wayne Gretzky played his final NHL season with the Kings in 1998-99, bringing unprecedented attention to hockey in LA.
The Dodgers' Vin Scully was the longest-tenured broadcaster in professional sports history, calling games for 67 years.
The Galaxy's Landon Donovan is the all-time leading scorer in MLS history with 145 goals.
Magic Johnson's 'Showtime' Lakers won five championships in the 1980s, revolutionizing fast-break basketball.
The Rams' SoFi Stadium is the most expensive stadium ever built, costing over $5 billion.
The Kings' 'Triple Crown Line' of Marcel Dionne, Charlie Simmer, and Dave Taylor was one of the most prolific scoring lines in NHL history.
The Dodgers' Jackie Robinson broke baseball's color barrier in 1947, wearing number 42 which is now retired across all of MLB.
The Galaxy's Zlatan Ibrahimović scored one of the most spectacular goals in MLS history with a 40-yard volley in 2018.
The Lakers' LeBron James became the first player in NBA history to record a triple-double against all 30 teams.
The Rams' Aaron Donald has been named NFL Defensive Player of the Year three times, tying the record.
The Kings' Anže Kopitar became the first Slovenian-born player to win the Stanley Cup in 2012.
The Dodgers' Fernando Valenzuela's 'Fernandomania' in 1981 captivated Los Angeles and helped popularize baseball among Latino fans.
The Galaxy's Robbie Keane scored 104 goals in 165 appearances, making him one of the most successful Designated Players in MLS history.
The Lakers' Shaquille O'Neal and Kobe Bryant won three consecutive NBA championships from 2000-2002, creating one of the most dominant dynasties.
The Rams' 'Fearsome Foursome' defensive line of the 1960s was one of the most dominant defensive units in NFL history.
The Kings' 'That 70s Line' of Jeff Carter, Tyler Toffoli, and Tanner Pearson was instrumental in their 2014 Stanley Cup run.
